title: Gianluigi Buffon's agent claims Juventus legend can keep playing until he's FORTY-FOUR
text:
Ginaluigi Buffon's agent Silvano Martina believes the 41-year-old can continue playing for another two seasons at Juventus.

The Italian goalkeeping legend returned to Turin this summer on a one-year deal after a single season at PSG, but has so far played second fiddle to first-choice Wojciech Szczesny.

But having made two appearances in Serie A, Martina says his client can continue playing until the age of 44, before perhaps moving into coaching.

Gianluigi Buffon returned to Juventus in the summer after a season at Ligue 1 champions PSG

Buffon made his first appearance since re-signing at home against Verona on September 21

GIANLUIGI BUFFON AT JUVENTUS Appearances: 658

658 Clean sheets: 312

312 Goals conceded: 519

519 Yellow cards: 10

10 Red cards: 5

5 Trophies: 19 - Serie A (9 times*), Serie B (once), Coppa Italia (4 times), Suppercopa Italia (5 times) *Not including revoked 2004-05 & 2005-6 titles Statistics according to Transfermarkt

On Buffon's return to Juve in the summer, Martina told Sportitalia: 'It was the right move because he is still competitive and strong.

'I think he'll have the chances to play this season and I believe he can play for another couple of years, take it up to the age of 44.

'I personally advised him to train as a coach for when he hangs up his gloves, as I think he could give his all in that role. He might enjoy it, too.'

Buffon has spoken recently about his desire to win the Champions League to cap off a trophy-laden career for both club and country, and his relationship with Cristiano Ronaldo.

'I must say, Cristiano is really a nice guy to be around,' said Buffon.

'We spend a long time discussing and preparing things, he interacts with his teammates. He has been a pleasant surprise.

'After that overhead kick he scored against us for Real Madrid, I asked him how old he was. He smiled and said: 'I'm 33. Not bad, right?'

Buffon hugs Cristiano Ronaldo after the Portuguese's overhead kick for Real Madrid in 2018

'I thought: 'Look at this son of a…' If you can't beat'em, you join'em!

'If he were to win the Ballon d'Or, and I hope he does, it'll mean Juve will too have won something important.

'I know that I never got one, but it's very tough for goalkeepers, the only shot-stopper who ever got the Ballon d'Or was the legendary Lev Yashin.'
description: The Italian goalkeeping legend returned to Turin this summer on a one-year deal after a single season at PSG, but has so far played second fiddle to first-choice Wojciech Szczesny.
